page.title: 16POLICE
page.content: Statistics for the crime rate of June 1984 was 417. Crime for June 1985 was 508. The Island is split into three beats for patrolling. To cope with the emergencies they have a section vehicle and can call a boat from the Isle of Wight called 'Ashburton' which helps in harbour troubles. One traffic warden is used for the summer months and another may be used if it is overcrowded.There are no traffic lights on the island.When an emergency is called in,the person taking the call must make a decision on if the emergency is a delayed response or an instant response.
